document.masterDocTitle: Notes on the bee genus Alloscirtetica Holmberg, 1909 in northern Chile with the description of two new altiplanic species and a key for the Chilean species of Eucerini (Hymenoptera: Apidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Notes on the bee genus Alloscirtetica Holmberg, 1909 in northern Chile with the description of two new altiplanic species and a key for the Chilean species of Eucerini (Hymenoptera: Apidae)

heading.emphasis: Key for the Chilean species of Eucerini

paragraph.keyLead:
3 F 1 longer than F 2 ; paraocular area yellow; clypeus uniformly yellow; labrum black; hind femur with a spine-like process at midlength; hind basitarsus strongly modified ...................................................................
Eucerinoda gayi
- F 1 shorter than F 2 ; paraocular area black; clypeus yellow with black spots; labrum yellow; hind legs unmodified 4

4 S 6 without posteriorly convergent carinae ................................................................................
Melissodes ecuadoria

6 Apex of F 10 modified; F 11 laterally compressed; middle and hind legs strongly modified.
Melissoptila tandilensis
- F 10 and F 11 unmodified (uniformly cylindrical); middle and hind legs unmodified .................................................. 7

7 Clypeal disc relatively flat; ocellocular area with dense pilosity, covering the integument; terga with a apical translu- cent band very narrow or absent .....................................................................................................
Melissoptila dama

- Clypeal disc uniformly convex; pilosity on ocellocular area not very dense, integument visible beneath hairs; terga with wide apical translucent band ................................................................................................
Melissoptila chilena

10 Basal half of clypeal disc black; T 4 to T 7 without white pilosity ................................................
Svastrides melanura

- Clypeal disc completely yellow; T 4 to T 7 with lateral white pilosity
.......................................... Svastrides orellanae

14 T 2 to T 5 with apical band of white pilosity, widely interrupted in the middle; rest of metasoma with black pilosity.
......................................................................................................................................... Alloscirtetica danuncia
n. sp.

- T 2 to T 5 with uninterrupted apical band of white pilosity; rest of metasoma with whitish or yellowish pilosity ........ .....................................................................................................................................................
Alloscirtetica cinerea

15 Dorsal pilosity on mesosoma yellow or orange; terga with apical bands of yellow pilosity ..
Alloscirtetica weyrauchi
- Dorsal pilosity on mesosoma whitish or yellowish; anterior area of middle ocellus depressed as triangle.............. 17

17 Terga with apical translucent bands; T 2 to T 7 with white and short pilosity .............................
Alloscirtetica chilena

- Terga without apical translucent bands; T 2 to T 2 with black pilosity ........................................
Alloscirtetica porteri

18 Clypeal disc covered by abundant white pilosity; labrum covered only with white pilosity
............ Alloscirtetica gayi

keyLead.keyStep:
20 Frontal area and metasoma with yellow pilosity
.......................................................................... Alloscirtetica herbsti

paragraph.keyLead: - Frontal area with white pilosity; metasoma with black and white hairs intermixed or forming apical bands on some

- Hind tibiae with dark brown and simple pilosity, if branched hairs, they are scarce
.............. Alloscirtetica tristrigata

22 Head and legs with whitish or yellowish pilosity
...................................................................... Alloscirtetica frieseana

23 At least T 3 and T 4 covered by white and long hairs
..................................................................... Alloscirtetica lanosa

24 Clypeal disc with smooth longitudinal line
................................................................................ Alloscirtetica gazullai

25 Gena with white pilosity; antennae orange brown
................................................................... Alloscirtetica antarctica

- Gena with dark brown pilosity; antennae dark brown or black
................................................. Alloscirtetica rufitarsis

27 Clypeus strongly protuberant; hind basitarsus with hairs of inner surface sparse, except for a narrow band of dense hairs near lower margin
.................................................................................................................. Peponapis citrullina
- Clypeus not or little protuberant; hind basitarsus with uniform dense pilosity.......................................................... 28
- Sector of vein r on margin of 2 nd submarginal cell longer or equal in length to vein 1 rm ........................................ 30

31 T 3 with basal band of white pilosity; T 4 without white pilosity ...................................................
Svastrides melanura

- T 3 without band of white pilosity; T 4 with a tuft of white pilosity on each side ........................
Svastrides orellanae

32 Prestigma clearly longer than the pterostigma; metasoma with black pilosity and basal bands of yellow hairs ..........
..................................................................................................................................................... Melissodes ecuadoria

34 Base of mandible yellow; tegula and veins yellowish brown .........................................................
Melissoptila dama

- base of mandible mahogany; tegula and veins dark brown .........................................................
Melissoptila chilena

36 Pronotal lobe with white pilosity; mesoscutum with light brown pilosity ...........................
Alloscirtetica vagabunda
- Pronotal lobe with black pilosity; mesoscutum with dark brown or black pilosity.................................................... 37

37 F 2 to F 9 black; basis of middle tibiae with tuft of white pilosity ....................................................
Alloscirtetica gayi
- F 2 to F 9 orange; middle tibiae completely covered with dark brown or black pilosity ........................................... 38

38 Apex of pygidial plate acute; tegulae light brown, almost translucent .......................................
Alloscirtetica porteri

- Apex of pygidial plate broadly rounded; tegulae dark brown
...................................................... Alloscirtetica chilena
- Mesosoma with dorsal pilosity white, brown or gray, at least dorsally .................................................................... 43

40 Head, mesepisternum, legs and metasoma, except T 1 with black pilosity ............................
Alloscirtetica antarctica
- Head, mesepisternum, legs and metasoma with whitish or yellowish pilosity .......................................................... 41

42 Tibial scopa with simple and yellowish pilosity .........................................................................
Alloscirtetica cinerea

- Tibial scopa with branched and dark brown pilosity .............................................................
Alloscirtetica weyrauchi

43 Tibial scopa with yellowish/ light brown pilosity
............................................................... Alloscirtetica gelida
n. sp.
44 T 2 to T 4 with apical band of white pilosity (complete or interrupted in the middle of T 2 ....................................... 45

45 Frontal area with white pilosity; T 2 with apical band of white pilosity uninterrupted
.......... Alloscirtetica tristrigata

- Frontal area with dark brown or black pilosity, T 2 with apical band of white pilosity widely interrupted in the middle
................................................................................................................................................... Alloscirtetica frieseana

- T 2 pilosity with black, if white hairs, they are scarce and located only at the basis of terga
.... Alloscirtetica rufitarsis

48 T 2 to T 6 with dark brown or black pilosity; apex of tibial spurs strongly curved
....................... Alloscirtetica lanosa

- T 2 to T 6 mostly with white pilosity, with some black hairs intermixed; apex of tibial spurs almost straight ...............
........................................................................................................................................... Alloscirtetica valparadisaea
